verses.kjv: Let us therefore fear, lest, a promise being left us of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short of it.
verses.web: Let’s fear therefore, lest perhaps anyone of you should seem to have come short of a promise of entering into his rest.
verses.ct: So let us be careful — because the promise of entering God's rest still stands, and we should fear that any of you might fall short of it.

verses.kjv: For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard it.
verses.web: For indeed we have had good news preached to us, even as they also did, but the word they heard didn’t profit them, because it wasn’t mixed with faith by those who heard.
verses.ct: The good news was preached to us just as it was to them. But the message they heard didn't do them any good, because they didn't combine it with faith when they heard it.

verses.kjv: For we which have believed do enter into rest, as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
verses.web: For we who have believed do enter into that rest, even as he has said, “As I swore in my wrath, they will not enter into my rest;” although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
verses.ct: We who have believed are the ones who enter that rest. As God said, "I swore in my anger, 'They will never enter my rest.'" He said this even though his work has been finished since the creation of the world.

verses.kjv: For he spake in a certain place of the seventh day on this wise, And God did rest the seventh day from all his works.
verses.web: For he has said this somewhere about the seventh day, “God rested on the seventh day from all his works;”
verses.ct: Somewhere in Scripture he said this about the 7th day: "God rested on the 7th day from all his works."

verses.kjv: And in this place again, If they shall enter into my rest.
verses.web: and in this place again, “They will not enter into my rest.”
verses.ct: And yet in the other passage he said, "They will never enter my rest."

verses.kjv: Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief:
verses.web: Seeing therefore it remains that some should enter into it, and they to whom the good news was preached before failed to enter in because of disobedience,
verses.ct: So the opportunity to enter that rest still remains open. Those who first heard the good news didn't enter it because of their unbelief.

verses.kjv: Again, he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To day, after so long a time; as it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.
verses.web: he again defines a certain day, today, saying through David so long a time afterward (just as has been said), “Today if you will hear his voice, don’t harden your hearts.”
verses.ct: That's why God set another day — called "Today" — speaking through David long afterward, just as was quoted before: "Today, if you hear his voice, don't harden your hearts."

verses.kjv: For if Jesus had given them rest, then would he not afterward have spoken of another day.
verses.web: For if Joshua had given them rest, he would not have spoken afterward of another day.
verses.ct: If Joshua had truly given them rest, God wouldn't have spoken later about another day still to come.

verses.kjv: There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.
verses.web: There remains therefore a Sabbath rest for the people of God.
verses.ct: So there remains a Sabbath rest for the people of God.

verses.kjv: For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God did from his.
verses.web: For he who has entered into his rest has himself also rested from his works, as God did from his.
verses.ct: Anyone who enters God's rest also rests from their own work, just as God rested from his.

verses.kjv: Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.
verses.web: Let’s therefore give diligence to enter into that rest, lest anyone fall after the same example of disobedience.
verses.ct: Let us therefore make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one falls by following the same pattern of unbelief.

verses.kjv: For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
verses.web: For the word of God is living and active, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the dividing of soul and spirit, of both joints and marrow, and is able to discern the thoughts and intentions of the heart.
verses.ct: The word of God is living and active — sharper than any two-edged sword. It cuts deep enough to separate soul from spirit, joints from marrow. It exposes the thoughts and intentions of the heart.

verses.kjv: Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do.
verses.web: There is no creature that is hidden from his sight, but all things are naked and laid open before the eyes of him to whom we must give an account.
verses.ct: Nothing in all creation is hidden from God's sight. Everything is naked and laid bare before the eyes of the one to whom we must give an account.

verses.kjv: Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our profession.
verses.web: Having then a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let’s hold tightly to our confession.
verses.ct: Since we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens — Jesus, the Son of God — let us hold firmly to what we profess.

verses.kjv: For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as we are, yet without sin.
verses.web: For we don’t have a high priest who can’t be touched with the feeling of our infirmities, but one who has been in all points tempted like we are, yet without sin.
verses.ct: Our high priest isn't someone who can't relate to our weaknesses. He was tempted in every way that we are, yet he never sinned.

verses.kjv: Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
verses.web: Let’s therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy and may find grace for help in time of need.
verses.ct: So let us come boldly to the throne of grace, where we can receive mercy and find grace to help us when we need it most.
